definition: to consider sb as close friend (idiom); to take into one's confidence
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
to know/to be aware
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: What kind of person will you take as good friend?
sentences.chinese: 什么样的人会让你视为知己？

sentences.english: I consider him my bosom friend.

definition: to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
intimate friendship/bosom buddies
to work together
intimate friend/close friend
best friend
soured by the loss of one's hopes
congenial
to have met once/casual acquaintance
familiarity at first sight
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to treat utterly sincerely/open and above board in dealing with sb
to view as strangers
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
very friendly/intimate
